title: 114_hr4867
content: The "Working Families Relief Act" is the short title of the Act. It expands the exclusion for dependent care assistance programs. The "Working Families Relief Act" expands the exclusion for dependent care assistance programs under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The maximum amount for such assistance is increased to $10,500, with adjustments for inflation starting from taxable years after December 31, 2017. The "Working Families Relief Act" increases the maximum amount for dependent care assistance programs to $10,500, with adjustments for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2016. The "Working Families Relief Act" increases the maximum amount for dependent care assistance programs to $10,500, with adjustments for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2016. SEC. 3. ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT FOR SMALL EMPLOYER DEPENDENT CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM START-UP COSTS. The "Working Families Relief Act" amends Section 45E of the Internal Revenue Code to include dependent care assistance programs as eligible employer plans. This applies separately to other eligible employer plans. Section 38(b)(14) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to replace "pension plan" with "employee benefit." The amendment also applies to the heading for section 45E and the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. These changes are effective for costs incurred in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2016, for dependent care assistance programs first effective after that date. SEC. 4. CREDIT FOR EMPLOYER DEPENDENT CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM MATCHING CONTRIBUTIONS. This section introduces a new credit for employers who make matching contributions to dependent care assistance programs. The employer dependent care assistance matching contribution credit is determined based on contributions made to a dependent care assistance program. The credit is limited to $1,000 per employee per year. Definitions in this section align with those in section 129. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new employer dependent care assistance matching contribution credit under section 45S(a). The credit is limited to $1,000 per employee per year. The new section 45S provides a credit for employer dependent care assistance program matching contributions. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2016.
